Generation II.Gold: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pok é mon to enter.
Generation II.Silver: There is no telling where the tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick at hunting Rattata .
Generation II.Crystal: It lives in narrow burrows that fit its slim body. The deeper the nests go, the more maze-like they become.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pok é mon to enter. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) There is no telling where the tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick at hunting Rattata . (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pok é mon is very nimble and fleet.
Generation III.Sapphire: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pok é mon is very nimble and fleet.
Generation III.Emerald: A Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, it is very nimble and fleet.
Generation III.FireRed: There is no telling where its tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick at hunting Rattata .
Generation III.LeafGreen: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pok é mon to enter.

Generation IV.Diamond: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It raises its offspring inside a long, narrow nest. Once they're old enough, it takes them outside the nest to prepare them for independence.
Generation IX.Violet: It is nimble and has a very flexible body. Even if you get ahold of it, it'll slip right out of your arms.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Route 1 Morning Day Safari Zone (tall grass in Swamp with 5 Plains points; tall grass in Wetland with 2 Plains points)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Route 1 Morning Day Safari Zone (tall grass in Swamp with 5 Plains points; tall grass in Wetland with 2 Plains points)
